titles.title: A bill to grant consent of Congress to the Northeast Interstate Dairy Compact.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S5179-5180)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Judiciary.

calendar.text: Committee on Judiciary. Ordered to be reported with an amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Judiciary. Reported to Senate by Senator Biden with an amendment. With written report No. 103-333. Additional and minority views filed.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 567.

bill.summary: 8/12/1994--Reported to Senate amended. Interstate Compact - Grants congressional consent to the Northeast Interstate Dairy Compact entered into among the States of Vermont, New Hampshire, Maine, Connecticut, Rhode Island, and Massachusetts to assure the viability of dairy farming in the northeast and to assure consumers of an adequate, local supply of milk. Limits compact regulatory authority to Class I milk. Authorizes Delaware, New Jersey, New York, Pennsylvania, Maryland, and Virginia to join under specified conditions. Requires the Compact commission to remove incentives for overproduction. Sets forth Compact provisions.
